intro: Sonchus laceratus, commonly known as the ragged robin, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, roadsides, and wetlands. Its leaves are deeply lobed and often have a rough texture, while the flowers are yellow with purple centers. Sonchus laceratus is an annual or biennial plant that blooms from late spring to early autumn.
